definition: to go all out/to work energetically
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
tree trunk/main part of sth/to manage/to work/to do/capable/cadre/to kill (slang)/to fuck (vulgar)

sentences.english: And while you've been absent, others have flourished.
sentences.chinese: 而就在你還沒回過神來時，其他人已經大幹快上了。

sentences.english: Jo's ambition was to do something very splendid.
sentences.chinese: 裘的志向是想轟轟烈烈地大幹一番。

sentences.english: Virtue. in the great world, should be amenable.
sentences.chinese: 在這大幹世界上，需要的是一種容人悔改的美德。

sentences.english: Gabriela Dabrowski, meanwhile, is thinking big.
sentences.chinese: 與此同時，東布羅夫斯基正想着如何大幹一場。

sentences.english: Mine leadership and the cadres and workers to watch a wonderful performance.
sentences.chinese: 該礦領導班子與廣大幹部職工一同觀看了精彩的演出。

sentences.english: The large disturbance stability also depends on the rate of the reactive power between electric source and the load.
sentences.chinese: 大幹擾的穩定性還依賴於電源與負荷的無功變化速度。

sentences.english: The mouth is so dry that it is difficulty for the patient to masticate and swallow food.
sentences.chinese: 口內大幹，以致病人咀嚼和吞下食物，都有困難。

sentences.english: There are companies across India and China who say they are raring to go.
sentences.chinese: 印度和中國的製藥公司都說他們渴望放手大幹。

sentences.english: This is Whitman's for-real next big gig.
sentences.chinese: 惠特曼這次可是要真刀真槍地再大幹一場。

sentences.english: These are the results that save broad cadre masses to try hard actively completely.
sentences.chinese: 這些是全省廣大幹部羣衆積極努力的結果。

sentences.english: Team was pumped to play chicago again, being an "up and coming team".
sentences.chinese: 球隊再度碰到芝加哥公牛隊，大家卯足了勁大幹一番。

sentences.english: I can imagine the temptation was just to roll it out.
sentences.chinese: 我能夠想象，大家很期待大幹一場。

sentences.english: I'm going to play it if I can get somebody to go in with me.
sentences.chinese: 如果能有個人和我合夥的話，我準備大幹一場。

definition: to be drowned (figurative and literal)
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
to suffer defeat in every battle (idiom)
lit. single spear and horse (idiom); fig. single-handed/unaccompanied
like a swarm of bees/everyone swarms around pushing and shouting/a hornet's nest
counting one's chickens before they are hatched
to wave flags and shout battle cries (idiom); to egg sb on/to give support to
total defeat of an army (idiom); fig. a complete wipeout
it is everyone's duty
red in the face/extremely angry
lit. lively dragon and animated tiger (idiom)/fig. vigorous and lively
lit. chasing the wind and clutching at shadows (idiom); fig. groundless accusations/to act on hearsay evidence
old school/conservative faction
to die in such a way that sb (or sth) else also perishes/to take sb down with oneself/to end in mutual destruction
lit. dumb as a wooden chicken (idiom); fig. dumbstruck
